comments.creator: mysql@hello.lv
comments.author: mysql@hello.lv
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:5.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0.1
Build ID: 20110707182747

Steps to reproduce:

Downloaded files from some file storage services (fileserve, filesonic, bitshare, wupload etc) as a free user. Some files already finished downloading, some did not. Then FF crashed.


Actual results:

After experiencing a crash (the crashes happened for different reasons and different FireFox versions from 3.x to 5.01, this is not the point), the files seem to be re-requested and overwritten by "you're not allowed to download 2 files in parallel unless premium user" type of html. This happens even if a file was already downloaded.


Expected results:

After a crash, FF should correctly check if a file already has been downloaded/exists and write to a "filename (copy version number)" type of file or not re-request the download at all. It seems that instead the download statuses are reset and no "file already exists" checking is done.
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:5.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0.1
Build ID: 20110707182747

Steps to reproduce:

Downloaded files from some file storage services (fileserve, filesonic, bitshare, wupload etc) as a free user. Some files already finished downloading, some did not. Then FF crashed.


Actual results:

After experiencing a crash (the crashes happened for different reasons and different FireFox versions from 3.x to 5.01, this is not the point), the files seem to be re-requested and overwritten by "you're not allowed to download 2 files in parallel unless premium user" type of html. This happens even if a file was already downloaded.


Expected results:

After a crash, FF should correctly check if a file already has been downloaded/exists and write to a "filename (copy version number)" type of file or not re-request the download at all. It seems that instead the download statuses are reset and no "file already exists" checking is done.

comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text: Interesting. You say the files that have download completed have still been overwritten? On the incomplete files this would be kinda expected, those services do not allow resuming of download. I can check this.
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.raw_text: Interesting. You say the files that have download completed have still been overwritten? On the incomplete files this would be kinda expected, those services do not allow resuming of download. I can check this.

comments.creator: mysql@hello.lv
comments.text: Yes, I'd be OK with uncompleted downloads reset, but I have had completed movies that took an hour or so downloading turned to 16 bytes. Doesn't seem to happen to usual downloads.
comments.author: mysql@hello.lv
comments.raw_text: Yes, I'd be OK with uncompleted downloads reset, but I have had completed movies that took an hour or so downloading turned to 16 bytes. Doesn't seem to happen to usual downloads.

Usual downloads = downloads from other sites than those mentioned?
After the firefox crash and restart, was the session restored? Did the download pages of those servers restore? Or did you get clean firefox, just the download manager tried to resume incomplete (and also complete) downloads?
comments.text:
Usual downloads = downloads from other sites than those mentioned?
After the firefox crash and restart, was the session restored? Did the download pages of those servers restore? Or did you get clean firefox, just the download manager tried to resume incomplete (and also complete) downloads?
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk

comments.text:
Usual downloads = direct links, no one file per session handling etc.
The session tabs were restored, download pages were restored, some at initial state (choose "premium" or "free download" start pages), some already marking that I've downloaded a file already (I think wupload.com even says "already downloading"). Then the download manager comes up and I see <1K bytes "download complete" (mixed with, say, OK size saved html pages etc) instead of previously complete/in progress "fileshare" downloads.
comments.author: mysql@hello.lv
comments.creator: mysql@hello.lv
comments.raw_text:

Then the download manager comes up and I see <1K bytes "download complete" (mixed with, say, OK size saved html pages etc) instead of previously complete/in progress "fileshare" downloads.
Understand. And do you have firefox set to download automatically to a predefined folder and don't ask for the folder everytime?
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk

comments.creator: trifandreialin@gmail.com
comments.author: trifandreialin@gmail.com
comments.text:
Have you tried to reproduce this issue?
For instance if you download some files from some file storage services(some are completed and some are still downloading) and crash your Firefox using Nightly Tester Tools:
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/nightly-tester-tools/
(after installing this addon go to Tools->Nightly Tester Tools->Crash Me!->and select any given option so you would make your browser crash)
Does it still happens after these steps?
Please get back with a comment.
Thanks!
comments.raw_text:
Have you tried to reproduce this issue?

Thanks!

comments.creator: mysql@hello.lv
comments.text:
upgraded to FF6.0, used Crash Me!
completed filesonic download left intact (OK)
in progress wupload download overwritten with "link has expired" message (OK)
in progress upfile download restarted (they allow 8 hours to download from generated link)
